entry.title: Fix layer input/output naming in coreml model
entry.content:
Operand name is optional and intermediate operands don't have name. So

we can't use them as identifiers for input/output identifiers in the

CoreML model definition at each layer.



Use operand_id for intermediate operands, and use operand's name,

prefixed with `input_` / `output_` for the whole graph's inputs and

outputs to east debuggability. The prefixes are added to avoid

collision with intermediate operands' ids.



Change-Id: I14f624fec9e751f5d565b8dceca78b027add051a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5277728

Reviewed-by: Reilly Grant

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1258734}

entry.title: Restore timing histograms for Windows sandbox
entry.content:
This CL restores timing histograms for sandboxed process

creation on Windows. The histograms are the same as those

removed in https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4241644

entry.title: Enable URLLoaderInterceptor for TerminalParams::ForNonNetwork cases
entry.content:
For consistency and upcoming changes, enable URLLoaderInterceptor for

TerminalParams::ForNonNetwork cases. This has no impact on non-tests

behavior because `GetTestingInterceptor()` is set only in tests.



`network::mojom::kInvalidProcessId` is used for now, to avoid subtle

issues around assigning a proper process IDs here (crbug.com/324458368),

and currently the process ID isn't used in tests other than the unit

test for URLLoaderInterceptor itself.



Bug: 1506871, 324458368

entry.title: gpu: Add GetUsageForMailbox on SharedImageManager
entry.content:
This change exposes a function SharedImageManager::GetUsageForMailbox.

SharedImageFactory already has a GetUsageForMailbox method, but it only

searches mailboxes that the SharedImageFactory created. The

SharedImageManager knows about all mailboxes.



This change also makes the existing SharedImageFactory variant fall back

to the SharedImageManager version.

entry.title: [bookmarks] Refactor BookmarkModel::Load() signature
entry.content:
No behavioral changes, pure refactoring to simplify the signature and

avoid accidental misuse outside iOS.



The case where, before this patch, StorageType::kAccount was used as

input to BookmarkModel::Load() was very rare, tailored to iOS, and

somewhat incompatible with the existence of feature toggles, namely

`syncer::kEnableBookmarkFoldersForAccountStorage`.



After all, BookmarkModel APIs have evolved recently to directly support

account bookmarks (without the need for another BookmarkModel instance),

starting with https://crrev.com/c/4952185. The historical iOS setup

where account bookmarks are loaded or "mapped" to regular,

local-or-syncable bookmarks is best achieved with a dedicated API that

shouldn't be adopted outside iOS.



Change-Id: Ib24b923efd72a1da1bd3847f40665c89c218876d

Bug: 41493391

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5277130

Reviewed-by: Sergio Collazos

Reviewed-by: Scott Violet

Commit-Queue: Mikel Astiz

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1258714}

entry.title: Drm: Always specify GAMMA_LUT
entry.content:
The last time something like this was tried, we set both DEGAMMA_LUT

and GAMMA_LUT. The DEGAMMA_LUT parameter is unreliable to the point

of being unusable. Closer examination of all paths that use it reveals

that they are all disabled.



This is not obviously the case for GAMMA_LUT, which is used by other

paths.



The GAMMA_LUT will need to be changed to implement night light and

ambient adjustment on platforms that have a functional DEGAMMA_LUT

(platforms where the CTM is applied in linear space) and on

platforms that don't have a CTM.



Bug: 1505062

Change-Id: I52d02b2ce624d0bb3c3f79e6ef36cd10e46a06e2

entry.title: [a11y extensions] Modify imports in testing for mv3 compatibility
entry.content:
The import() function is fully not supported by service workers, so we

need a different solution for how to import modules in tests.



This change adds infrastructure to do that, and provides an example of

how to update the imports to the new method.

entry.title: Add fieldtrial testing config for `ChromeOSHoldingSpaceWallpaperNudge`.
entry.content:
The fieldtrial testing config is required on the client in order to add

a corresponding config on the server for the holding space wallpaper

nudge experiment (http://shortn/_NNzreUPGst).



By introducing the fieldtrial testing config early, browser tests will

begin to run with the experimental feature flag enabled, providing an

opportunity to surface unexpected issues before branch.



Note that this CL also fixes a crash that it surfaced.

entry.title: [ Companion ] Migrate Companion pref into PinnedActionsToolbarModel Fix
entry.content:
Fixes a bug where the migration of the

`kSidePanelCompanionEntryPinnedToToolbar` profile pref only happened on

startup / instantiation of the PinnedToolbarActionsModel even though

the pref could be changed at any point during a browser's session.



To fix this, we call the migration code any time

CompanionUtils::UpdateCompanionDefaultPinnedToolbarState is called.

This will attempt to migrate the pref into the

PinnedToolbarActionsModel, if it hasn't already. All current callers

at the time this was written are covered by this change.

entry.title: [FedCM] Fix modal type in button flows
entry.content:
Previously, we used modal type window which is a modal where the user

cannot navigate to a different tab. In some OSes, it would also show a

modal that is in the middle of the website, whereas it should be on the

top overlapping the line of death. This modal type would allow the

user to navigate to a different tab, and will overlap the line of

death in all OSes.

entry.title: iwa: Take bundle buffer in ScopedBundledIsolatedWebApp instead of file
entry.content:
This updates ScopedBundledIsolatedWebApp to take a std::vector

instead of a ScopedTempFile. This makes it easier to use

ScopedBundledIsolatedWebApp with bundle builders other than

IsolatedWebAppBuilder, and encapsulates the temp file entirely within

ScopedBundledIsolatedWebApp instead of having it take ownership of a

file that someone else created.

entry.title: oak birch: revamp bar to have tight bounds
entry.content:
Current bar horrizontally occupies the whole space even the content

does not. This cl makes the bounds tight with following changes:

1. Change the bar from 3 level nested box layout to 2 levels such

that the bar is the direct parent of chip rows.

2. Add a function called UpdateAvailableSpace to ask the bar

container to provide the available space and the bar will

relayout according to the space.

3. Add a function called GetContainerPaddings which returns the

paddings to the bar container to calculate the available space.

4. The bar will only relayout when adding and removing chips, and

available space changed.

The final effects are shown in the bug comment.



Bug: b:324481974

Change-Id: I95e387a7da671e7271c074e2bb9d5208bcc6620a

entry.title: Resolve internal forced colors properties before used value time
entry.content:
This CL moves the re-resolution of internal forced colors properties

(specifically 'internal-forced-color', 'internal-forced-visited-color'

and 'internal-forced-background-color') to occur before used value

time. This is necessary because work is being done to remove system

colors from being stored in the NativeTheme to being accessed from

color providers that are associated with the Page(see CL:4898493). To

access the color providers, we need to pass them from the document to

the LayoutTheme::SystemColor method.



However, this is problematic in StyleColor::Resolve, where we currently

pass a boolean flag(`is_forced_colors`) to resolve the initial values

for these forced color properties at used value time(see: CL:2529950).

This was done because the initial values for these properties are

defined as system colors in css_properties.json5

(e.g. StyleColor(CSSValueID::kCanvas)). These values are only computed

once, so we need to recompute them to ensure they pick up the correct

color on theme change.



We want to remove this flag to avoid resolving any system colors at

used value time, which will allow us to pass nullptr instead of a color

provider when resolving colors in StyleColor::Resolve, since we do not

have an easy way to access the provider at this point in the rendering

pipeline.



To solve this, we re-resolve the initial values of these properties in

the StyleAdjuster class to avoid the need for re-resolution at used

value time. Also, we propagate the `internal-forced-background-color`

from the root to the viewport when forced colors is enabled.



Bug: 1430181

Change-Id: I5c12bff59c8ae7d760ffc34dd6d4d2d050bf0019

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5181788

Reviewed-by: Anders Hartvoll Ruud

Reviewed-by: Alison Maher

Commit-Queue: Sam Davis Omekara

entry.title: [HitTestTransparency] Experimental status
entry.content:
The feature uses cc::HitTestOpacity::kTransparent for pointer-events:

none. The flag is first marked on paint chunks, then PendingLayer and

cc::Layer, by merging cc::HitTestOpacity from merged painted results.

The merge algorithm (which is already ready for HitTestOpaqueness)

can handle cases such as pointer-events:none with pointer-events:auto

descendants (which will be merged into cc::HitTestOpaqueness::kMixed).

cc::Layer::HitTestable() is now based on this flag for blink.



For test coverage, this CL also includes changes to make existing

tests pass or fix existing bugs with the feature:

- LayerTreeHostImpl::BuildHitTestData() now handles a SurfaceLayer

with pointer-events:none even if it doesn't draw contents, to make

CrossSiteSubframe/DragAndDropBrowserTest.CrossTabDrag/* pass.

- Correct hit test transparency for scrolling contents.

- Correct hit test transparency for frames under pointer-events:none

container (b/323688987).

- Correct hit test transparency for scrollbar layers in boxes with

pointer-events:none (b/324092420).

- New tests.



ClusterTelemetry job shows that it can reduce main thread scrolling (hit test or repaint) by 36% (kFailedHitTest by 40%,

kNonFastScrollableRegion by 67%) compared to HitTestOpaqueness only.



Bug: 40062957, 323688987, 324092420

entry.title: [gbb-cct] Fix bug where PIH comes back in broken state after being suppressed due to other bottom sheet.
entry.content:
If while PIH is in peek state you trigger another bottom sheet, the PIH sheet is hidden. Then when the other sheet is hidden, the PIH state is restored.



This currently doesn't work as intended: PIH is reappearing in expanded state (even though it was in peek before), and with no content within it (see demo video in bug). This is due to various assumptions being made in our code around the lifecycle of the sheet, and these assumptions being broken by the sheet being restored when another sheet is dismissed.



For now we fix this by removing the restoration logic. If in the future we decide it's important for it to be restored then we can look into bringing this logic back in a non-broken way.



Bug: 324573154

entry.title: Support ICU 74 in `LazyTextBreakIterator`
entry.content:
This patch extends the `kBreakAllLineBreakClassTable` table

for 5 new LineBreak classes in ICU 74.



They are for Brahmic scripts, which "line breaks can occur at

the boundaries of any orthographic syllable"[1]. The

`break-all` has no additional break opportunities that all

entries are `0`.



This patch also adds `0` for 3 classes added in ICU 58[2],

instead of doing so in code, to make future additions

possible.



[1] https://unicode.org/reports/tr14/#BreakOpportunities

[2] https://chromiumcodereview.appspot.com/2440923002



Bug: 324419151

Change-Id: I8002edb927280f63b5b668b09076cc71feaeac3e

entry.title: v4l2/stateless: MT2T should convert to P010
entry.content:
The previous code was incorrectly expecting the P016LE

format to store the data in the LSB. That is incorrect.

The LE designator it show that it is little-endian.

Both P010 and P016 store the data in the MSB. Doing

it this way allows for casting between formats without

shifting.

entry.title: Add parameterization to the BMP Suite unit test.
entry.content:
`skia_gold->CompareScreenshot` is an expensive call, and calling

it several times in a loop can cause slow-running bots like ASAN

and TSAN to time out. Instead, we now split apart the test via

parameterization so that the watchdog sees progress being made

and doesn't timeout the test.

entry.title: Add accessibility features API tests in manifest v3
entry.content:
This change makes the existing accessibility features API tests run

using manifest v3. To do so, we:



1. Create a manifest for each v3 extension

2. Copy-paste the v2 background.js files

3. Modify the JS so that it will work with manifest v3 e.g. remove the

call to chrome.app.runtime.onLaunched.addListener()

4. Modify the C++ so that it points to the new extension if the

manifest version is v3

entry.title: Remove regular users from list upon stale user cleanup

Our logic for determining if the user is new on the device

is convoluted, and in different places use different signals:

- presence in user list

- existence of cryptohome

- presence of Profile in user's crypotohome



This CL closes the gap for regular users to treat them

as new if their cryptohome was lost, even if user is

present in the list of users.

entry.title: A non-invertible gradient/patternTransform make the paintserver invalid
entry.content:
The gradient/patternTransform properties follow the rules of the CSS

transforms spec:



"If a transform function causes the current transformation matrix of an

object to be non-invertible, the object and its content do not get

displayed." [1]



Check if the relevant transform is non-invertible and flag the paintserver

as invalid if it is.



[1] https://drafts.csswg.org/css-transforms/#transform-function-lists



Fixed: 40742883

Change-Id: I53c65ff1d21f04e740aa0941ffc09aa6a465149d

entry.title: Add support for app names in getAllScreensMedia notification
entry.content:
Before this CL, an accepted call to getAllScreensMedia would always

show the origin of the calling page in the triggered notification.

During origin trial, developers asked to have the app name shown

instead for installed apps, which also provides better information

to the user if IWAs (as the final target platform) are used.

With this change, the notification will show the app name in case

the caller is a an app (PWA, IWA, ...).

entry.title: [omnibox] Reports # of zero-prefix suggestions in Autocomplete session.
entry.content:
Omnibox currently reports the number of zero-prefix suggestions shown in

searchboxstats (gs_lcrp=) only if the user selects a zero-prefix

suggestion. In other words, omnibox does not take into account the

zero-prefix suggestions previously shown to the user if they end up

typing and selecting a prefixed suggestion. This is incorrect and makes

a number of otherwise insightful Bsb metrics useless. See

go/chrome-zps-metrics-101 for details on the affected metrics.



This CL introduces the concept of a session in the AutocompleteResult

which is reset when the AutocompleteController resets the

AutocompleteResult - i.e., on popup closing. This is not to be confused

with when the AutocompleteController clears the matches - e.g. on the

last async pass. This allows the session metadata to be carried over

between the "old results" (results from the previous query) to the

"new results" (results from the current query) until the popup is closed. The session metadata is at the moment restricted to the number of zero-prefix suggestions. If it proves to work well, it can also

include the "previous suggestions" in the future.



Pros:

The scope of changes is restricted to the Autocomplete classes allowing

it to work across all platforms (verified by Mobile teams).



Alternative considered:

Building on top of the existing concept of

AutocompleteController::ResetSession() and

OmniboxTriggeredFeatureService. Unfortunately that definition session

does not work for zero-prefix suggestions as it defines a new session

as when the user starts editing the input. Changing that definition

involves making changes to the Omnibox UI classes (not used by Chrome

Android) and to the Mobile platforms codes which takes a much larger

amount of investment.



Future work:

Exploring whether this approach can replace

OmniboxTriggeredFeatureService and whether it can be consolidated with

AutocompleteControllerMetrics for a single more manageable and better

tested metrics. Eventually bringing the concept of session metrics to

OmniboxLog can enable a variety of potentially useful session metrics

to omnibox histograms.



Bug: 1307142

entry.title: media/gpu/test: Change location of P010 -> I010 conversion
entry.content:
P016LE is the same as P010. The LE designator is for little-endian.

Both of these formats have the data stored in the MSB. I010 has

the data stored in the LSB. There is no need for the transport

frame to have the data downshifted, that should only be done

during the conversion from P010 to I010.

entry.title: Link Query Tiles Instant Fetch to QueryTilesInZPSOnNTP feature.
entry.content:
This change proposes that the QueryTile fetches are not delayed when

the Omnibox feature QueryTilesInZPSOnNTP is enabled.



The retrieval of QueryTiles is delayed by up to 12h, during which we

would not be showing any tiles in the Omnibox. If the user leaves and

kills the application before the fetch is complete, the scheduling is

restarted the next time Chrome is opened.



If Chrome is never kept alive for long enough, the users may never see

QueryTiles.



Omnibox caches internally QT data for (a configurable duration of) 8h.

Once QueryTiles data is retrieved, the Omnibox will not request the

update until that timeout expires (or until Chrome is killed).



Change-Id: I602f31e47cd9cf190debf594cdb8e1f675483999

Fixed: b:324142195

entry.content:
The custom passphrase should be migrated to the gaia-keyed pref that was

introduced in crrev.com/c/5237310 for all users on all platforms.



This CL adds the logic to migrate to the new pref, that is:

* controlled by the feature kSyncRememberCustomPassphraseAfterSignout

* called early during browser startup

* done for all users with a custom passphrase set

* done only once, tracked by

kSyncEncryptionBootstrapTokenPerAccountMigrationDone

entry.title: Disable CSS ScrollbarColor and ScrollbarWidth based on web setting
entry.content:
This is the last of a series of 4 CLs implementing logic that could

allow users to disable custom scrollbar styling based on a web

preference. This is important from an accessibility perspective as

some scrollbars with custom styling can be too low-contrast because

the color contrast is not high enough or the width is too thin.



This CL adds the logic to disable CSS ScrollbarColor and ScrollbarWidth

properties in the new function

`StyleAdjuster::AdjustForDisableCustomScrollbars()`.



Without a UI implementation or an entry in about:flags, there is no way

for users to actually access this setting at this time. But these

changes strive to make that possible for a future implementation.



Bug: 1012117

Change-Id: Ia9ebf21d13cc5c8fd6f9d50d73a4198b465236b3

entry.content:
- Updated payments_suggestion_bottom_sheet_delegate.didSelectCreditCard()

(and the path of calls leading to it) to accept a CreditCardData object

as opposed to only the NSString backendIdentifier.

- Updated payments_bottom_sheet_mediator.didSelectCreditCard() to add a

kVirtualCreditCardEntry PopupItemId to the FormSuggestion when a virtual

card is selected. Note that this is flag-protected, but perhaps

unnecessarily as no user can select a virtual card if they are not

being shown (the showing of virtual cards is flag protected).

not been wired together just yet, so there is no visible change to screenshot here.

entry.title: Fix InterpolableNumber interpolation and add type info
entry.content:
Previously, the interpolation by double values would occur only

if the first interpolable number was double, regardless of whether

the second one was double or expression, now it's fixed to use the

double path only when both interpolable numbers are doubles.



Also, type info is added for cases when one of the interpolable

numbers is double and another is expression. It's needed to correctly

create math expression node from the double value, as addition of

math expression is done with the type deduction.



Bug: 41494232

entry.title: [ios] Fix BrowsingDataRemoverImplTest
entry.content:
BrowsingDataRemoverImplTest expect that there is no global

ClipboardRecentContent registered when it runs. This was

not true because MainControllerTest registered one global

instance but forgot to remove it.



This caused the following failure:



[12643:259:FATAL:browsing_data_remover_impl_unittest.mm(90)] Check

failed: ClipboardRecentContent::GetInstance() == nullptr

(0x13a014539c0 vs. nullptr)



This was not visible on the bots because they retry failing

tests without running tests that happen before them.



Bug: none

entry.title: [ios] Update -insertModuleIntoMagicStack early check
entry.content:
It is possible that the magic stack has been created before

the Segmentation ranking has been received. So it is important to check

_magicStackRankReceived so that indexForMagicStackModule: doesn't

find no matching module type.



crrev.com/c/5278424 removes multiple Safety Check module types,

so there should never be a situation where the ranking needs to be

updated.

entry.title: Drop account storage opt-in offer on save after explicit opted out
entry.content:
Behaviour changes are behind flag.

Before this CL if the user opts out of account storage in

chrome://passwords-manager, then saves a password, they are

immediately offered to opt in again. After this CL they aren't.

This is achieved by setting the default pref store explicitly to

kProfileStore when the chrome://password-manager toggle is disabled,

which then affects [1].



The CL also includes an unrelated fix: stop unnecessarily compiling

password_manager_settings_service_impl on non-android platforms.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/passwords/bubble_controllers/save_update_bubble_controller.cc;l=288;drc=8e453be292a43b73a61f5ac8ab232ea8cf239baf

entry.title: [BrowserSwitcher] Record LBS UMA metrics on startup
entry.content:
Add a --from-browser-switcher switch to Chrome. When writing cache.dat,

this flag is always included in Chrome parameters. This causes Legacy

Browser Support's native host to launch chrome with

--from-browser-switcher.



When Chrome is launched, record whether --from-browser-switcher was

supplied or not in a histogram. This lets us know how often

IE=>Chrome or Edge=>Chrome bounces happen.

entry.title: Remove NavigationURLLoaderImpl::url_chain_
entry.content:
Use `network::ResourceRequest::navigation_redirect_chain` instead,

which records every URL in the redirect chain once.



This is to simplify the logic and make

`NavigationURLLoaderImpl::PrepareForNonInterceptedRequest()`

more like a stateless URLLoaderFactory factory decoupled from

navigation loader's state changes.



Actually these have different values (and are also updated in a

different timings):

- The initial request URL is:

- Always added to `navigation_redirect_chain`

- Not added to `url_chain_` if the first request is intercepted

- Each of subsequent URLs in the redirect chain is:

- Always added once to `navigation_redirect_chain`

- Added twice to `url_chain_` if the redrect leg is not intercepted



However, this doesn't change the behavior in most of the cases,

because only the last two elements of `url_chain_` are used

and the last two elements (at the time of the uses)

are the same before and after this CL,

except for just after the initial request is redirected by a

ServiceWorker.



Thus, the (potential) behavior changes are: After this CL,

- The initiator origin passed to `HandleExternalProtocol` when

the initial request is redirected by ServiceWorker to an

externally-handled URL might be fixed.

- `Navigation.ReceivedResponse` UKMs are no longer collected

for cases involving a redirect by ServiceWorker.



And anyway the new behavior should be correct.



Bug: 1403746, 324378187

Change-Id: I3d08f34a4145d85eb054d85039c37e4ba086712d

entry.title: media/gpu/chromeos: Create GBM media compressed buffer with
entry.content:
passed modifier in Chrome



Before this CL, the video decoding path in Chrome has a

feature flag and a environment variable

|ENABLE_INTEL_MEDIA_COMPRESSION| to have minigbm allocate

the appropriate graphics Intel media compressed buffers.



This CL has the change to let Chrome pass the specific DRM

modifier with the function CreateBufferWithModifiers() to

minigbm without the environment variable. Then minigbm can

compute the metadata and allocate the compressed buffers

based on the information explicitly stated.

entry.title: [A11y] Restore text change optimization that avoids walking ancestors
entry.content:
This optimization was originally added in CL:4574033 "do not include

hidden states when they are ignored", but caused the failure of

a TAST test for ChromeOS, where a disabled

button's name was not being updated when the inner text changed.

This part of the CL was an optimization for updating related text,

using the new cached "is used for label or description" bit to

exit that function early, and was not necessary for the rest of

the change (so probably should have landed separately).



The optimization code was removed in CL:5277477.



It is restored here as it now passes the disabled button test that

was added.



The fix is:

1. Match the logic between ComputeIsUsedForLabelOrDescription() and

UpdateRelatedText().

2. In both cases, elements which are either

focusable or not ignored are considered as potentially being

affected by inner text changes, as long as

SupportsNameFromContents() which considers the role also

agrees.



Bug: none

entry.title: [omnibox] add a flag to toggle on device tail model for single word prefix.
entry.content:
Enabled (current):

http://screenshot/Bv9ixEV2djzjrVr (Desktop)

http://screenshot/9pANmDtr62F4ZCs (Android)

Disabled (after):

http://screenshot/mPV7vt8ZZgpB9ny



This should be disabled by default for now (maybe except CJK in future):

1. UI is not working properly: "..." is being added before the entire suggestion on Android, and is missing on Desktop.

2. Qualities of the single word prefixes not covered by head model are usually low, and their corresponding tail suggestions are also bad. The issue might be mitigated by adjusting the probability threshold, but we are not sure how this will affect overall coverage of the tail model.
